de.mrapp.android.preference.activity

Class PreferenceActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • Activity
      • de.mrapp.android.preference.activity.PreferenceActivity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AdapterListener, FragmentListener

    public abstract class PreferenceActivity
extends Activity
implements FragmentListener, AdapterListener
    An activity, which provides a navigation for multiple groups of preferences, in which each group is represented by an instance of the class PreferenceHeader. On devices with small screens, e.g. on smartphones, the navigation is designed to use the whole available space and selecting an item causes the corresponding preferences to be shown full screen as well. On devices with large screens, e.g. on tablets, the navigation and the preferences of the currently selected item are shown split screen.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Michael Rapp

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected static java.lang.String CURRENT_BUNDLE_EXTRA
      The name of the extra, which is used to save the parameters, which have been passed when the currently shown fragment has been created, within a bundle.
      protected static java.lang.String CURRENT_PREFERENCE_HEADER_EXTRA
      The name of the extra, which is used to save the currently selected preference header, within a bundle.
      protected static java.lang.String CURRENT_SHORT_TITLE_EXTRA
      The name of the extra, which is used to save the short title, which is currently used by the bread crumb, within a bundle.
      protected static java.lang.String CURRENT_TITLE_EXTRA
      The name of the extra, which is used to save the title, which is currently used by the bread crumb, within a bundle.
      static java.lang.String EXTRA_BACK_BUTTON_TEXT
      When starting this activity and using EXTRA_SHOW_BUTTON_BAR, this extra can also be specified to supply a custom text for the back button.
      static java.lang.String EXTRA_FINISH_BUTTON_TEXT
      When starting this activity and using EXTRA_SHOW_BUTTON_BAR, this extra can also be specified to supply a custom text for the back button when the last preference header is shown.
      static java.lang.String EXTRA_NEXT_BUTTON_TEXT
      When starting this activity and using EXTRA_SHOW_BUTTON_BAR, this extra can also be specified to supply a custom text for the next button.
      static java.lang.String EXTRA_NO_HEADERS
      When starting this activity, the invoking intent can contain this extra boolean that the header list should not be displayed.
      static java.lang.String EXTRA_SHOW_BUTTON_BAR
      When starting this activity, the invoking intent can contain this extra boolean to display back and next buttons in order to use the activity as a wizard.
      static java.lang.String EXTRA_SHOW_FRAGMENT
      When starting this activity, the invoking intent can contain this extra string to specify which fragment should be initially displayed.
      static java.lang.String EXTRA_SHOW_FRAGMENT_ARGUMENTS
      When starting this activity and using EXTRA_SHOW_FRAGMENT, this extra can also be specified to supply a bundle of arguments to pass to that fragment when it is instantiated during the initial creation of the activity.
      static java.lang.String EXTRA_SHOW_FRAGMENT_SHORT_TITLE
      When starting this activity and using EXTRA_SHOW_FRAGMENT, this extra can also be specified to supply the short title to be shown for that fragment.
      static java.lang.String EXTRA_SHOW_FRAGMENT_TITLE
      When starting this activity and using EXTRA_SHOW_FRAGMENT, this extra can also be specified to supply the title to be shown for that fragment.
      protected static java.lang.String PREFERENCE_HEADERS_EXTRA
      The name of the extra, which is used to saved the preference headers within a bundle.

      Hides or shows the fragment, which provides navigation to each preference header's fragment.

      Returns, whether the behavior of the action bar's back button is overridden to return to the navigation when a preference header is currently selected on devices with a small screen, or not.

      Returns, whether the fragment, which provides navigation to each preference header's fragment, is currently hidden or not.

      Returns, whether a preference header is currently selected, or not.

      Returns, whether the preference headers and the corresponding fragments are shown split screen, or not.

      • EXTRA_NO_HEADERS

        public static final java.lang.String EXTRA_NO_HEADERS
        When starting this activity, the invoking intent can contain this extra boolean that the header list should not be displayed. This is most often used in conjunction with EXTRA_SHOW_FRAGMENT to launch the activity to display a specific fragment that the user has navigated to.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        public final void addWizardListener(WizardListener listener)
        Adds a new listener, which should be notified, when the user navigates within the activity, if it is used as a wizard, to the activity.
        Parameters:

      • removeWizardListener

        public final void removeWizardListener(WizardListener listener)
        Removes a specific listener, which should not be notified, when the user navigates within the activity, if it is used as a wizard, from the activity.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be removed, as an instance of the type WizardListener. The listener may not be null

      • getPreferenceHeaderParentView

        public final ViewGroup getPreferenceHeaderParentView()
        Returns the parent view of the fragment, which provides the navigation to each preference header's fragment. On devices with a small screen this parent view is also used to show a preference header's fragment, when a header is currently selected.
        Returns:
        The parent view of the fragment, which provides the navigation to each preference header's fragment, as an instance of the class ViewGroup. The parent view may not be null

      • getPreferenceScreenParentView

        public final ViewGroup getPreferenceScreenParentView()
        Returns the parent view of the fragment, which is used to show the preferences of the currently selected preference header on devices with a large screen.
        Returns:
        The parent view of the fragment, which is used to show the preferences of the currently selected preference header, as an instance of the class ViewGroup or null, if the device has a small screen

        Returns:
        The view group, which contains all views, which are shown when a preference header is selected, as an instance of the class ViewGroup or null, if the device has a small screen

        public final void addPreferenceHeadersFromResource(int resourceId)

        public final void addAllPreferenceHeaders(java.util.Collection<PreferenceHeader> preferenceHeaders)
        Adds all preference headers, which are contained by a specific collection, to the activity.
        Parameters:
        preferenceHeaders - The collection, which contains the preference headers, which should be added, as an instance of the type Collection or an empty collection, if no preference headers should be added

        Returns:

        public final void clearPreferenceHeaders()

      • selectPreferenceHeader

        public final void selectPreferenceHeader(PreferenceHeader preferenceHeader)
        Selects a specific preference header.
        Parameters:
        preferenceHeader - The preference header, which should be selected, as an instance of the class PreferenceHeader. The preference header may not be null. If the preference header does not belong to the activity, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown

      • selectPreferenceHeader

        public final void selectPreferenceHeader(PreferenceHeader preferenceHeader,
                          Bundle parameters)
        Selects a specific preference header.
        Parameters:
        preferenceHeader - The preference header, which should be selected, as an instance of the class PreferenceHeader. The preference header may not be null. If the preference header does not belong to the activity, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        parameters - The parameters, which should be passed to the preference header's fragment, as an instance of the class Bundle or null, if the preference header's extras should be used instead

      • selectPreferenceHeader

        public final void selectPreferenceHeader(int position)
        Selects the preference header, which belongs to a specific position.
        Parameters:
        position - The position of the preference header, which should be selected, as an Integer value. If the position is invalid, an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown

      • onCreatePreferenceHeaders

        protected void onCreatePreferenceHeaders()
        The method, which is invoked, when the preference headers should be created. This method may be overridden by implementing subclasses to add the preference headers at the activity's start.
